content:
Rain chances don't become a real threat until late in the day on Sunday, close to dinnertime. As the night ticks on, the downpour will only get heavier.

Conditions stay wet and blustery all night long, surely making for a real mess of Monday morning. Winds will ramp up late Sunday as well – gusting to 60 mph for parts of NYC and Long Island.
Provide the weather forecast sum-up in one sentence as if you were advising a friend what to do under such weather conditions if he/she had to drive far on such a day.

chosen: Based on the information provided in the text, it is not recommended to be driving during the storm since winds will be gusting up to 60mph, which can make driving dangerous. The rain will also make roadways slippery, increasing the risk of car accidents. It would be best to wait out the storm or adjust travel plans altogether to avoid being on the roads during hazardous weather conditions.
rejected: Based on the information provided, it seems like there is a risk of heavy rain and winds later in the day on Sunday, continuing into Monday morning. If your friend has to travel, they should keep a close eye on the weather and plan accordingly, considering potential delays or difficulties due to these adverse conditions.
